cmp: 匕 (an ancient type of spoon, dagger/ladle)
mng: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity, old (of people), venerable (person), experienced, of long standing, always, all the time, of the past, very, outdated, (of meat etc) tough

exm.mng: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity, old (of people), venerable (person), experienced, of long standing, always, all the time, of the past, very, outdated, (of meat etc) tough
old man or woman, the elderly, one's aged parents or grandparents
old age, aging, aged, geriatric, the aged
(coll.) eunuch, see also 老公[lao3 gong1]
to age (of person or object), becoming old
old road, familiar way, beaten track, conventional behavior
elderly, old age, autumn of one's years
uncle (polite form of address for older male)
